B00DSMAZUW.ATIHDHZYNQ0EI.reviewText: I took a leap of faith and bought this for my 4.75 year old son (43" tall, 38 lbs). He had literally one thing on his Christmas list, so on Christmas Eve, when he said, "Mom, do you think someday I can have a lightening bolt shirt?", I jumped! I can't even believe I found this, let alone that it's Diesel, but leave it to Amazon to have everything! Unfortunately, there wasn't a sizing guideline on Amazon, and Diesel's own website was equally unhelpful. I kept searching the internet and really found no information. So, knowing the sizing of this shirt is to fit 2yr olds to 7 yr olds in xxs-large, I made a presumption that the xs would fit my average-sized boy. I was a little wrong, as the shirt is a little big for him, but the good news is that it'll probably fit him until he's 6 yrs old. As far as the shirt goes, the material is of good quality, isn't too thin, has not shrunk (he's worn this 3 times in 6 days, and after 3 washes, is still the same size), and the design is nicely printed. It has a bit of a vintage element to the design, purposefully a little faded, and looks really cool. It's printed in a thinner ink, so it feels comfortable on the body, unlike old fashioned iron ons or appliqués. I highly recommend the shirt, but only 4 stars for not providing more helpful sizing information.
B00DSMAZUW.ATIHDHZYNQ0EI.summary: Good quality, but some sizing assistance would be nice

B00DWX76UY.A2KZQ6ZK98FSI7.reviewText: These are really  nice jeans, but they don't work for me.  I am 5-11, 175 pounds with an athletic build.  I have a 31 inch waist.  These jeans do NOT have enough room in the legs for me.  I have muscular legs, but not HUGE...think a tennis players body.  The waist was fine, but my thighs were strangled to the point of discomfort.  I feel these jeans should be labeled as skinny and not slim.
B00DWX76UY.A2KZQ6ZK98FSI7.summary: Nice style, but not the right fit.  (Details below for my body type)

B00DWX76UY.AWNZC6MEVGIM8.reviewText: I loved these jeans but I guess my thigh just could'nt support it.  I was happy to catch a deal on these too but I had to return it and let it go.  I bought only 1 pair out of 3 Safado's that actually fit good.  I wont give up on safado but I hope the next one I try will do me justice.
B00DWX76UY.AWNZC6MEVGIM8.summary: Wish the thigh was just a little looser

B00DWX76UY.A3U774VHGT0WQI.reviewText: These are quality jeans as to be expected from Diesel.  They do seem to run larger in the waist and have longer inseam in comparison to the Zatiny.  The wash is nice these are the 823i wash.

B00DWX76UY.A2LDQUUEGSJ78W.reviewText: what can i say,  its DIESEL,  i can not get enough of these jeans,  in others words they are endless!!!!

B00DWX76UY.APWVJ6QTQK5P7.reviewText: I previously have owned 34/30 safados in the 885 wash which fit me well but they have 2% elastine to give them a little stretch - over time they stretched out a little too much but shrink back after a hot water wash and putting them in the dryer so it's ok but I didn't want to have to do that with these so I ordered 33/30 and in this color are 100% cotton = no elastine so less stretch - my hope was they would stretch just a bit and fit me just right.  I know if they stretch out too much I can wash them and tighten them up.  But not necessary -  33/30 is a snug fit and as I have been wearing them they are stretching out ever so slightly as I wished.  I'm not a slim fit person normally and these jeans have just the right amount of room for error.  They are stretching out just fine and fit me snug but comfortably.  I give a damp towel wash to freshen them up and know that once they are properly broken in I can hand wash in cool water to get them just right.  So don't be afraid to order 33/30 if are normally a 34/30 and find those stretch out too much overtiime.  Wear them over and over unitl broken in properly.  remember no elastine in this wash so be patient and wear them all the time so they stretch out just right for you.  Do not over size these there is room for error and in time will fit you just right.  I was nervous about going to a 33 vs 34 waist but they do in fact fit me just right.  The color is rich and the quality is great!!  In the diesel store they are $228.  Soo great price here and they are the real deal.  Very pleased

B00DWXUFES.A2BAO3M7NNUEE6.reviewText: Diesel clothing normally fits pretty snug to my body and fit very well. This, however, was like wearing a khaki colored blanket.

B00DWZ0F5A.A3TJCJLRMZ33TH.reviewText: Perfect in keeping with diesel tradition.

B00DWZ0R44.A1TSMFWLWOQ5D1.reviewText: I was looking for a casual sweater but this was not it.  The overall look and feel of the fabric was too much like a sweatshirt and for the price that just wasn't going to work for me.  I love Diesel clothing in general but not this article.

B00DWZHYTA.A3UOAEKRZLDJR8.reviewText: The jeans were an unexpected gift and fit like a glove. Was a little concerned about the slim feature in the jeans but the material made it easily flexible and maintained it's comfort and hugged the body well even when getting into a sitting or bending position. The cost of the jeans seem high but the quality is clearly seen in the material. I love the style but are more suited for dressier occasions.

B00DWZHYTA.ADYBHM2LBZ0A7.reviewText: I have fairly muscular legs so I had to order one waist size up from my normal size of 31 to 32 in order for the jeans to fit in the thighs.  The legs are tight, however the material is stretchy so they fit and there is plenty of room in the waist.  The jeans look great- highly recommend them and any Diesel product.

B00DYQFHIW.A2USMIT2CSA08.reviewText: I am 5'7'', 120lb and I got 26x32.The jeans fit me well in terms of the size (26). However, these appear much longer than 32in, on me they are ~2 inches too long.The fabric is soft so the pants drape well. Overall I enjoy the fit a lot---it is very slimming on me and what is more---the looser leg is very comfortable.

B00DYUR43Y.A3RKKUXW9EBODC.reviewText: The jeans fit very well and the dark wash is very classy looking.  These will work well for events that are not quite formal, but more than casual.

B00DZLNMJW.A27XRJ6MFJ1BX4.reviewText: Really nice purchase! And half price if you compare with the original store! I recommend this denim, everything was perfect.
B00DZLNMJW.A27XRJ6MFJ1BX4.summary: Really nice purchase! And half price if you compare with the original store!

B00DZLNMJW.A3ID4FLW51IV68.reviewText: Great jeans. I bought these for my man few months ago in a Diesel store. He loved them right away, so when I found them for a fraction of an original price I was really happy. I would definitely recommend those to any guy who needs a "professional looking" pair of jeans.

B00DZLNMJW.A1Q4CBVJPQOPWV.reviewText: I couldn't believe how inexpensive these jeans were. I've been a fan of Diesel jeans for years now. It's my denim choice. The fit and cut of a Diesel jean is like no other. I'm a lifetime fan of diesel and will continue to purchase their brand of clothing. They are not cheap, so I always have my eye out looking for a deal but I do purchase them full retail just the same.

B00DZLNMJW.A3MW9ST9442GOO.reviewText: I got these a few months back. Slimmer fit but not to where it is annoying. Great color. Never seen it before. Really nice with an oxford to work or church or with a t-shirt.Wish this fit came in a different color.

B00E1CWYA2.A2USMIT2CSA08.reviewText: The material is very thin, almost see-though! Not a quality I was looking for in pants. The fabric is soft, yet scratchy. Moreover the fit is strange---it is tight in legs, yet too big for my stomach/waste. [I'm 120, 5'7'', 34-25-36]. I also with the length was longer.

B00E1CX3GQ.A3QRJPB202WA85.reviewText: I am withholding the fifth star based on color. I ordered the black, but what I got looks more blue-grey with white splotches instead of black with brown splotches like the picture. The manufacturer's tags say they are, indeed, black, so I don't know what kind of photoshop trickery went on with the listing. Before ordering, I actually went to Diesel's website to check their size chart so I could get the right size on the first try. I am 5'7" and a size 8, and Diesel's size chart told me to order a large. They fit perfectly, which means these pants run a little small. The length is good, the pants brush the floor in my bare feet. They are much thicker and warmer than I was expecting. The outside face of the fabric feels like any sweatpant material and the inside is a nice brushed fleec-y feeling. If the color had been more like the picture, I'd give these five stars. They will keep me warm through the cold months ahead, and will be OK to wear to sit home or to get out and run errands.

B00E1CXD16.A1M2N6OMAYP9Y.reviewText: Great top, very comfortable. The acid wash type fabric is subtle because of the dark color. However, because of the very boxy shape, unless you have ample breasts to create shape, it gives the appearance of a pregnant tummy....

B00E1CXD16.A146X6FEWX7Q0D.reviewText: The color was slightly different than I expected. On my monitor it appeared to have hints of grey but it reality it was more of a rustish color. But It was still perfect. It fit as expected We got a large (normally wear a med but wanted it to be baggy).

B00E1CXMF8.AUB5UOO2FE1VF.reviewText: Very nice and confortable tee!! I love the color and it fits perfectly well. I ordered a medium and it was perfect.

The material is very thin, but not in a cheap way, it's just the style. The seams are all well made, the adjustable waist is an asset. Very comfortable.

B00E1DB8A8.A2PV1Q99D0K8RN.reviewText: These are nice boxer trunks although they do tend to ride up a bit. There is no slit in the middle for the solid colors and only in the striped ones. That is a bit of an inconvenience in my opinion, but otherwise good product.

B00E1DB8A8.A1VY2CG81I1JRR.reviewText: I tried these along with the Hanes 5-pack and the Fruit of the Loom 4-pack, and these were far and away the worst (and the most expensive!). My biggest complaint was that, despite them being my waist size, felt too small in length to be boxers- these were briefs.  As such they were uncomfortable in a way that the longer (and thicker) Hanes and FotL were not.  Finally, the colors in the package didn't exactly match those in the photo, and that was part of my original purchase decision.

Don't be fooled by the relatively low price, I should've returned it and used the credit to buy a nicer watch.  I haven't worn this watch a single time since I bought it and am not sure when I will be wearing it.

B00E9RNQE2.A2Q8QQ26HOSS74.summary: great christmas gift,best quality coat i ever bought

B00EEI801U.A2A2T7MIB4OS6W.reviewText: I'm 5' 7", but have a narrow waist and broad shoulders. I wear 30" waist jeans and a 40 inch sport coat. I'm built sort of like Mark Wahlberg and Jason Statham. maybe 2/3 as big as those guys. Anyhow, I ordered the medium and it just barely fits through the chest and shoulders. A small would be way too tight (too tight to zip closed. Impossible to wear). At 5' 7", the jacket comes just about two inches (maybe 1.5 inches) below my belt. If you're 5' 9", it will stop at your belt (it depends on the length of your torso).The jacket is decent looking. It doesn't look nearly as nice as a 950 dollar Moncler jacket. But this is 60% less expensive. It look decent and has a sort of moto jacket vibe. It is thin. I have yet to wear it outside. I presume will be fine over a cashmere sweater down to about 25 degrees. I highly doubt it's good in temps below 20 degrees F. I have a super bulky Moncler puffer that kept me warm at 6 degrees F last week. I'll try to wear this Diesel jacket between 20 degrees F and 40 degrees F.It is much more streamlined than my bulky Moncler. In the Moncler (one of the cheaper models like 750 or 800), I look like the Michelin man. The Diesel jacket is more like a normal fall jacket in terms of bulk. It's about as non-bulky as a down jacket can be. But i wouldn't cross-country ski in Maine in it. I would walk two miles in NYC in it.

B00EEI801U.AILRYL3Z97XKA.reviewText: This is a very good jacket, it feels nice and definitely keeps you warm. I got the blue one and it looks great with a variety of things. I am 180 cm (~5'11) and 145 lb- a slim body and usually wears size small for all jackets. But I heard that Diesel's jacket tend to go one size smaller, so I ordered a size up to medium. Which to my surprise was indeed the way to go, even with a size medium it fits fairly snug- but not so tight that its uncomfortable. The quality for this jacket isn't as good as I expected to pay for yet nothing too significant that's worth complaining about. Overall this jacket is worth getting- it looks good, keeps you warm and easy to clean; just remember to order a size up from what you usually wear or go to their website and look at the sizing information as the one that's provided on this site is different from the one that Diesel uses.

B00EEI801U.A24VQG7J8R5XZE.reviewText: I really like this jacket as it looks very nice on me. I got compliments from wearing it and I like hidden pocket inside and the hood that is hidden and I can easily use when it rains (I'm in Seattle and it is pretty wet here). Fabric is very soft, very comfortable to wear, and it is nicely made. Guess quality should be worth the price. I'm 5'8 and bought the small size. It fits perfectly well, but I need to keep telling myself not to gain a few more pounds on the belly otherwise I will not be able to zip it~This jacket is perfect for the winter as it is pretty warm. It had some funny smell when I first wore it and it was still there even after I washed it (not sure if it was the smell of whatever fabric they use). Now after almost one month, I think it's gone, or my nose has gotten used to it. By the way, it was pretty easy to wash. I put it in the washing machine and washed it with cold water (no softener, no tumble dry), and I hung it for a day. And the only thing I gave this jacket a four star instead of five is because of the color. It doesn't look as red as the picture. The color is lighter than the picture and it is somewhat pale, but it is still acceptable for my taste and the overall look still makes me keep it. I am still happy that I bought it!

B00EEI801U.A2DZGVR607T9FP.reviewText: Nicely made,got lots of compliments and will buy more if they have them in different colors.Willing to recommend to friends.
B00EEI801U.A2DZGVR607T9FP.summary: Nicely made, wish they have logo

B00EEI801U.A2OWMMJL3BJQQY.reviewText: This jacket is exactly what I expected from diesel brand. Very modern look in a fitted jacket. Perfect addition to your winter apparel if you want style that stands out.I did a lot of online shopping around for this jacket (eBay, Zappos, ect.). Amazon had the best price and shipping arrangements.

B00EEI801U.A22I92EKJTCG32.reviewText: This jacket is amazing and does a wonderful job of bridging the gap between really warm winter coat and casual night time cold weather jacket....and it has a great grungy moto fashion forward vibe to it that makes it dressy or casual but still functional.I can see it not being the best at below freezing temps with just a t-shirt on underneath but with sweater or thick long-sleeve this jacket works wonders. I recently brought it to NYC during this whole polar vortex thing  and it was amazing.Diesel Jackets and all of their clothing in general fits a bit snug or trim/slim, euro (or whatever you want to call it) so I always suggest going up a size in everything but their Denim. Ex. I usually wear no bigger than a large in most brands but I consistently wear XL in Diesel Jackets, Shirts, Button Ups, Sweaters, underwear.Great brand. Great product and Amazing price! Current line in stores marked at 50% off on Amazon. You can't lose!

B00EEI801U.AGGS4R403V6TT.reviewText: Just because my girl friend doesnt want me to wear this color. RecommendedThe price is good too. you will love it

B00EF14B82.A12SPZRHXVBSW7.reviewText: This product was just what I was looking for and hard to find -lighter weight with long pants and long sleeves.  Unfortunately my husband has a belly and these pajamas are fitted and therefore the XL was way too tight.

B00EF14B82.A2TF8ONCE8QUHM.reviewText: My son (age 48) has been looking for just the right billfold to replace the one that has seen a better day. When he opened it Christmas morning, he said it was exactly what he had been looking for. He needs something that has a place for his Drivers' License that is easy to get to when in the airport. He said it's of good quality, and meets his needs.  I am happy because I don't like to buy gifts for my family that have to be returned. He moved into this product before the end of the day; it's a keeper.

B00EF14B82.APBSA01K3NS0A.reviewText: I wear Diesel exclusively for their unique styling, tailored fit and excellent bud quality.  These pajamas feel as though they are manufactured with those same qualities in place.  They run a little snug, so go a size larger than normal.  I don't like tight pajamas, I prefer room to move around.  They are fairly soft, though I think they will be softer after a few washes.

B00EI444TW.A1OOWZKVR2SJXP.reviewText: Fits like a glove. The interior is a suede-like material and feels unbelievably comfortable. Very stylish too, I can't wait to wear them with a pair of chinos. Seems like a steal for $36.

B00EI444TW.AJDWF4BG82WIL.reviewText: The price was incredible... On Sale... for less than $35.00.  Once rec'd it seemed clear these were "seconds" defective workmanship in the stitching. Nowhere in the advertisement was there any mention of the this possibility.  I returned immediately.  However after close inspection I would suggest these sneakers would not make it past a couple of weeks wear.  Amazon this was a disappointment.

B00EI444TW.A3PJLUEQIEOUYD.reviewText: I purchased these in black when they were on sale.I wasn't sure what to expect because I've purchased Diesel shoes in the past and they have always required about a month to break in.If you're flat-footed you will need inserts, which was something I was prepaired for and with my inserts they feel very nice,without them very painful, I like the ankle support which is the main reason I purchased them, I have arthritis in my ankles and I need the compression.Day 2 and they're breaking in faster then other models I've purchased.I wanted something age appropriate,stylish, comfortable that may be worn with jeans or shorts and these are great for that purposeThe sale price at $50.00 is about right.I was going to buy the white but the orange throws me and it limits what you can wear with them.A bit on the narrow side but fit better then I expected them to..

If I could sit down with the designers, however, I might take a little of the gloss away from the heel.  I wish that's all I had to complain about, in the greater scheme.  These are as close to perfection as a comfort/walking shoe gets.

B00EIF8M4E.AM6QJNDT8WYA6.reviewText: These boots are so frickin cute!  I got the black pair (I wish they made them in red!) and plan to wear them when I go to England and Ireland in May.  I am pleased as they are pretty lightweight and that counts for something when traveling (I bought a pair of Dr. Marten Drench Wellies and they were heavier and clunkier, not to mention cost twice as much; I returned them).  I should probably wait to wear them in the rain to see if my feet actually stay dry but they are so darn cute I had to rave right away.  I normally wear an 8 and I bought a 7.5 based on reviews that I read on Zappos.com (where they cost more btw!).  The 7.5 are still a little big but better a little big than a little small--I can always wear thicker socks and once I put my comfy insole in the fit will probably be better.  Even so, the fit isn't that bad and they're comfortable, even though they are a little too big.Anyway, very cute and I'm so pleased to finally find a good looking, stylish rain boot!  If they made them in leather I'd buy a pair ;o)

B00F0SF6Z6.A2HGS2M1KS8CPH.reviewText: Good price for a pajama, it's comfortable and soft and i can use outside of my apt without problems because looks nice.

B00F0SF6Z6.A2K50JFFPUH6HG.reviewText: They are sized strangely.  I have lots of Diesel clothing, especially their jeans and I wear a 32x32.  I know that other Diesel garments aren't sized as generously as some other brands so I went ahead and ordered the X-Large Derik pajama pants.  I wanted them to fit loosely and be comfortable.  While they fit "ok", drying them in the dryer with my other sweats and lazy clothes isn't an option.  If I were going to order another pair, I'd order the XXL, a first for me, lol.  They are VERY lightweight fabric, well made and soft.  They also have an unexpected silver metallic thread running through the white stripe vertically.  Can't beat the price and they arrived quickly as usual.  I knocked a star off for the sizing because according to the size/measurement chart they should have been huge and even a long time brand loyalist (me) didn't get the appropriate size for my desired fit.

B00F0SF6Z6.AX55DCEUUXF9I.reviewText: These diesel pajama pants are well made and capable of all season wear.  Its a light fabric that gives enough heat in the cold of winter, but does not retain enough that you swelter when it is warmer.  The sizing of the pajama pants was suprising, but I should have expected that Diesel pajama bottoms would be far tighter to the leg than your run of the mill pajama bottoms.  Lastly, the colors in the picture are a true representation of the bottoms, but what you cannot see is that there is a metallic foil/thread that  runs along the vertical stripes that adds an interesting aspect to the pajama bottoms.  Very happy having spent $20 on these.

B00FZN1FBA.A7XZW0K70ACL6.reviewText: I normally don't write reviews, but this jacket deserves one.  First of all, the picture doesn't do it justice.  The color in the pic looks almost brown, but it is, indeed, black.  It has a somewhat distressed finish which gives it almost a slate color.  It arrived a day early! Bonus!  I love the structured look.  It feels rock n roll, fresh, big city night life.  The zips and snaps give it an edgy look, almost like a biker jacket.  This jacket doesn't need a fancy outfit to go with.  It speaks for itself.  Just a pair of nice jeans and a plain tee and you're good to go.  Perfect with a pair of Chucks or Jordans.  I was a little apprehensive about spending so much on one article of clothing, but after seeing the craftsmanship, I realized its worth every penny.  You get what you pay for, and this just oozes quality. The lining is great, too.  It's now the sexiest thing in my wardrobe. Keeps you warm, too.  I can't say enough.  I will be wearing this out on New Year's Eve and I'm sure I'll turn a few heads.

The XXL size claims to for a waist of 50-52 inches but is still smaller than any of my other 42 jackets! Luckily it fits snuggly.  After 2 returns I finally got one that fits!

B00HFN9B5U.A31H7GWC7KPSB2.reviewText: I've tried several light blue distressed finish skinny jeans, and these are my favorites. The material is not stiff like some are, and they are a good length for me. I don't like jeans that are very short. I don't find the ankle length flattering to my legs, and these are a great length, fit a feel for me. I also got them on a sale that Amazon was running bringing them within my price range. (The full price is a little high for me.) The softness makes them really feel like well-aged jeans, and the contemporary stretchiness makes them more comfortable than some of my actual old jeans. My size varies between 27 and 29 depending on the cut. In these, I am a 28, which is what I would call true to size. However, my hips and legs are slim, so it's possible if you have fuller hips you might have to go up a size. My waist is not as small as in my youth - that's my tough to fit part - but these jeans definitely have a low rise, making the waist size less of an issue. If you want jeans that feel like you've had them for years, but don't feel like they'll fall apart after a few washings, these might be just the right jeans for you, as they were for me.
B00HFN9B5U.A31H7GWC7KPSB2.summary: Very soft nicely faded light blue jeans

B00HO7E2Y2.A34PMFIT3HWNIU.reviewText: Let me say first that I am a regular Diesel jeans customer. I know most people do not consider "normal" to spend 200-300 bucks in a pair of jeans. This, however, is a matter of style and, thus, this review is intended for people with an acquired taste for premium jeans brands.I have owned more than 15 jeans from this brand,  including styles as Safado, Darron, Biker and Belther. When I bought my first Diesel jeans I began using Safados, but these jeans have a very skinny fit and I have reasonably thick thighs (I ride my bicycle everyday), so I changed into a more "relaxed" style and I started buying Belthers and Darrons, which are still skinny fit jeans but not that skinny around the thighs.Bottom line, I received these jeans and I immediately fell in love with them from the moment I put my eyes on them. However, surprisingly these jeans somehow have a "Safado" fit (i.e. they have a very skinny fit around the thighs).I am not returning these 'cause I really liked them, but it did made me unhappy to see that these Belthers did not have the type of fit I am used to.In the overall, if you do not have the same issue I do with my thighs, do not hesitate to buy these jeans. You will be acquiring durable and stylish jeans and you will always get complimented whenever you wear them.

B00HZEVBG6.A2VALCFTOWFYXZ.reviewText: There are no jeans 'for summer', as you're gonna sweat anyhow, but those are relatively soft and thin.The looks is less bright than the picture, the main color is *very typical* light blue rather than 'almost white'. That's dissapointing, as in the picture it looks special but in realy it's just like any other bright jeans. For that price I'd have expected Diesel to create more significant constast in colors, not just use a standard pattern. 1 star dropped.Some say the Waykee is a 'slim straght' but I don't think it's slim, it's a regular str8 IMO. They look really good on the body, not restricting and 'heavy to move in' like some other jeans. 100% cotoon means they're relatively 'breathing' too.They are expensive, however I don't own manny jeans at all (expect those I have only 2 more), as I don't like how modern fits sit on my body.. Personally I don't think a man should look like a carrot, but that's not what fashion designers think as everything today is tight and the leg opennings are tiny small.So if you just want to look like a MAN, but still owning jeans which look much better and stylish than any 50$ un-branded one, I think the Waykee worth the price, as it really looks super cool.Diesel's former 'Straight' fit (larkee) was too 'relaxed' for me, I think the new Waykee fit is much sexier and looks better. Maybe a bit more conservative.
B00HZEVBG6.A2VALCFTOWFYXZ.summary: (relatively) Soft jeans, not the 'thick' unflexible kind

B00JRQQFQ6.A3JFEQAM0F6JP4.reviewText: I have worn several pair of Diesels since the late 1980s.  The Safado is one of my favorite cuts ever, however; it is for a specific body type and depends on what one looks for in jeans.  I'm 6-1 and fit.  I have long legs.  These pants fit great.  They have enough stretch that they never pull.  They have enough that they don't stretch out after a few hours and not fit.  I've worn them several days without a belt and it was only after six or seven days of wearing that I needed a belt.  This is key for me with jeans.  These fit medium to low and lower as one wears them between washings.  The fit is tight in the thighs and them tapers from the knee.  The bottom is a slimmer opening which I love.  They look better as one wears them between washings.  I wash them as little as possible and I highly suggest washing them on gentle cycle in addtion to cold and inside out.  I've thrown them in the sink with woolite and prefer to do that were it not for time constraints.My one issue with Diesel is that it is not necessarily made in Italy anymore.  Nothing beats a good pair of pants made in Italy.  They started making them in Romania and the fit was a bit different, in general, with all Diesel.  I'm glad they are still made in the EU.  I hated seeing these go outside of Italy.  However, once I learned the newer fits, the Romanian made Diesel was still pretty good.  Now I see these are being made in Morocco. I fear the fit is going to be different and the quality not as it was.  This being said, I do not know.These are great jeans if you are looking for something a big snug but stretchy.  They tend to fit tighter in the thigh area than the waist and a lot of people have problems with that.  I personally like it.  They feel great out of the box.  I have had several pair and do the most to not wear them in as they are already designed to be such.
B00JRQQFQ6.A3JFEQAM0F6JP4.summary: Great cut of Jeans Overall, Is the quality still there?

B00JRQQFQ6.A3VCMUUO1G4IZG.reviewText: You know these are solid jeans before you even open the sealed black plastic bag.  When they arrived, I was surprised by how heavy the bag felt for jeans.  Even though these are distressed jeans you don't fear these ripping anytime soon.  They are heavy and strong.To help people get the right sizing, I will add my comments.  These are slim jeans but not skinny jeans.I wear size 33/32 for every type of pants.  In almost every case, the fit is perfect around the wait with dress pants always staying the same and jeans giving a little (stretching).  I end up needing a belt after awhile, but I like belts for fashion sense anyway.  These jeans were exactly the same for waist size.  A perfect fit right out of the bag.  The length was another story.  I guess it is "in" to wear slim jeans with the bottom of the pants rolled up once or twice, and with these, you would have ample space.  I would say that these are more like 33/34 and that is ok with me but if these were dress pants they would be going back.  For anyone who has the same fit for all their pants, 33/32 in my case - I would probably want 33/31 and I highly doubt that is a size option.  33/30 would probably be a perfect fit just touching the tops of my shoes...  that is how much extra length is available in these pants.  I am an older guy and I don't want to roll up the bottom of my pants and I can manage.  These are low riding on the hips and tighter in the thighs just as expected.  If you have a slimmer figure with bigger thighs like me, they have a nice tight fit in the thighs and getting looser from the knees down with a tighter fit at the ankles.  If you know you size, I would definitely think twice about the length unless you want to fold these up at the bottom.Great quality, thick and strong, great distressed look and fit.  You get what you pay for...
B00JRQQFQ6.A3VCMUUO1G4IZG.summary: You really do get what you pay for...

B00KGGMTRA.ADD0IXLM8UWQ3.reviewText: First of all, this watch pictured is not the DZ1657, it is the DZ4323, so don't be surprised if you don't get the watch pictured (no sub-dials).  My review is for the DZ4323, which is what is pictured here.Before getting into the horrible technical design of this watch I must say that this is by far the coolest watch I've ever seen (in terms of pure looks).  It looks far better in person than it does in the picture, the blue almost glows, very cool.  But, whoever designed the "tick marks" on this watch is a complete idiot.First, the 1/10 second sub-dial has 12 TICKS!!  TWELVE!!!  It should obviously have 10 because it is supposed to be measuring in 1/10 of a second, not 1/12.  The designer obviously just used the same sub-dials as the second and minute ones without even thinking about it.  What a moron.  Since every 1/2 rotation of the 1/10 second sub-dial is 1 second, each tick is 0.16666 of a second instead of 0.1.  I'm not going to get into the math you have to do to calculate 1/10 of a second with this watch, but it's annoying (easy, but should be unnecessary).Second, instead of having 4 ticks in between each hour mark (making for 60 ticks all the way around, 1 for each second) it has 7!!!  WHY SEVEN?!  I could understand 9, making each tick a half of a second, but SEVEN?!  This makes the second hand completely useless for telling time, and means that the second hand will never land directly on a tick.  Because of this, you can't use the ticks to tell how many seconds have elapsed on the current minute.Like I said, this is an absolutely gorgeous watch, a true sight for sore eyes, but is completely useless for telling time if you want to measure in anything smaller than minutes.  Seriously Diesel, this is just embarrassing.  Are your designers just stupid, or do they just not care, or pay any sort of attention to what they're doing?This could have been a god tier 5/5 watch, but Diesel totally blew it.  Way to go, idiots.

B00KNCCU6W.A2VDXLMCECB039.reviewText: These jeans are amazing quality and extremely flattering! They are such a cool material too almost like a coated denim? Its hard to describe, they are just so smooth and refined looking. These are totally worth the price. It seems like this particular one is out of stock at the moment but try the diesel grupee in other washes! Just be aware diesel run a size small. Im normally a 27 and in this brand I'm a 28.
B00KNCCU6W.A2VDXLMCECB039.summary: By far my favorite jeans I have ever owned!
